newsitem.title: HONG KONG: CITIC Pacific signs HK$3.8 bln loan.
newsitem.headline: CITIC Pacific signs HK$3.8 bln loan.

text.p: CITIC Pacific Ltd has signed a HK$3.8 billion equivalent term loan facility with 41 international banks, the coordinating arrangers said Friday.
The facility is comprised of two tranches.

Tranche A of HK$2.942 billion is structured as a 24-month revolving credit converting to a term loan and will be available in both Hong Kong and U.S. dollars. It has a tenor of seven years with a put option at the fifth anniversary.
Tranche B of US$110 million has an availability period of 6 months and a bullet maturity at the end of year seven.

Tranche A pays an interest margin of 60 basis points per annum from year one to five and 70 basis points per annum from year six to seven, while tranche B pays an interest margin of 67.5 basis points per annum throughout the life of the facility.
Fees range from 45 to 55 basis points for tranche A and 52 to 66 basis points for tranche B.
Proceeds of the facility will be used for general corporate purposes, including refinancing of maturing debt facilities and for new investment in CITIC Pacific's core businesses.
The coordinating arrangers are Chase Manhattan Asia, HSBC Investment Bank Asia and JP Morgan Securities Asia.
